Authors:
Tsuyoshi Hosoya, Yasuko Hanafusa, Tomoo Kudo, Kenichi
Tamukai, Yumi Une
Title:
First report of Veronaea botyrosa as a causal agent of
chromomycosis of frogs.
Keywords:
anuran mycosis, disseminated mycosis, zoonosis, phylogenic
analysis, phaeohyphomycosis
Abstract:
A dematiaceous hyphomycete was isolated from frogs as a
possible pathogen of chromomycosis based on histopathological
examination, and identified as Veronaea botryosa based on morphology and
molecular phylogenetic evidence. Although V. botryosa has been known to
be distributed widely as a litter fungus and also known as a human
pathogen, this is the first report of lethal infection confirmed in
cold-blooded animals including anurans.
